past simple and past participle of
photograph
B2 to take a picture using a camera: I prefer photographing people rather than places. [ + obj + -ing verb ] MacKay was photographed leaving the building. Synonym
snap (PHOTOGRAPH)Compare
pap verb informal mainly UK photograph well/badly
to appear attractive/unattractive in photographs Compare
photogenic
More examplesFewer examplesMacKay was photographed leaving the building.The Princess was photographed shaking hands with AIDS victims.He has photographed her against lots of different backgrounds.I prefer photographing people rather than places.The actor is photographed in profile, smoking a cigarette.
